name: Justicia adhatoda basaka
Relationship: Seems to come between CEPA and EUPHRASIA, which compare.

Head: Irritable, sensitive to external impressions; hot, full and heavy head; lachrymation, with coryza, profuse, fluent, with constant sneezing; loss of smell and taste; coryza with cough
Respiratory: Dry cough from sternal region all over chest
Asthmatic attacks, cannot endure a close, warm room
Paroxysmal cough, with suffocative obstruction of respiration
Throat: Dry, pain during empty swallowing, tenacious mucus

details: Highly efficacious medicine for acute catarrhal conditions of the respiratory tract (used in the beginning).
dosage: Third potency and higher. Severe aggravation have been noticed from lower potencies.
